summary: You want to marry Khajiit in Skyrim? Who says you can't?
descriptionHtml:
You want to marry Khajiit in Skyrim? Who says you can't? 

---

EDIT:
To any and all who experience CTD and are trying out the Optional Files, please do report back if it works out. I'm trying to figure out if the method I used to remove dependencies is viable. Thanks!

Also: Am dropping off the face of the Nexus again, because University. Not that this [i]will[/i] impact anyone in particular, but just in case.

--- 

Hello. I have no excuses. Except: Bethesda kept breaking my heart (and my mod) with all their DLCs.
However! With ESO, there probably won't be any more DLCs, so lo and behold, at long bloody last.
...I still don't know if I uploaded this correctly though.
Apologies to all who waited, gave up, hopefully found something better, was using a miraculously working older version and had it suddenly deleted, etc. etc. etc.

PS: I still don't have voice actors, m(_ _)m

--- 

DESCRIPTION: 
This mod is exactly what it says on the tin, simple and easy. You can now marry any of the Caravan Khajiit or J'zargo without any console commands. If you want Ma'iq, or anycat else, use the console commands. My logic, don't ask. After learning about marriage from Maramal, go talk to the head of the Caravan Khajiit, Ri'saad, for a little enlightenment on the eligibility of Khajiit in Skyrim. The Caravan members will all immediately be available, but J'zargo will need you to finish up his quest.

The bugs that apply to the original marriage system still apply, and I've decided not to crack my head over a problem I didn't cause. This means you'll probably have to chase your Khajiit down to select your house choice. And if you have them live with you, Lover's Comfort may not apply. Choose to live with your Khajiit instead, and the objective to live with him or her will appear. If your Khajiit has a house, perfect. If they're from a caravan, I've added a dialogue option to help you finish up without stalking them across Skyrim. Just talk to them and select the appropriate dialogue. It should be pretty obvious.

Also, there's additional dialogue for female Khajiit followers, so that it's actually possible to have female Khajiit followers. Not that there are any. Console!

I didn't debug particularly thoroughly but there shouldn't be any compatibility issues or bugs. You can drop a comment, but I just, I just seriously gave up. The source files are all in there, if anyone wants instructions, in fact, PM me and have them with my thanks.

---

FAQ:

What do I do?
Talk to Ri'saad after learning about marriage from Maramal, and select "What do the Skyrim Khajiit think of marriage?". Follow through, then court your Khajiit as per normal.

My Khajiit spouse is freezing at the altar?
Save on the spot and reload, the scene will have skipped ahead to your vows and you can proceed.

My Khajiit just walked away after the ceremony?
Vanilla bug, just chase him or her down.

My Khajiit spouse lives in the caravans, how do I visit his/her 'house'?
Talk to him or her while he or she is in the caravan, and select "So, this is what it's like in the caravans."

Lover's Comfort doesn't turn up?
Try sleeping over once with the Caravans (you'll have to catch them when they're set up and sleep in one of their bed rolls). Otherwise, vanilla bug, I don't know either.

I want to marry J'zargo or Ma'iq, though?
Finish his quest, and he'll warm up to you. Console for Ma'iq, not because I can't do it for you, but because he's not part of the Caravans and so the logic doesn't add up in my head.

My game is crashing to desktop (CTDing). Help?
I programmed this mod over all the DLCs, ie Skyrim Legendary Edition. I thought this would be the way to go for a CTD-less experience, but apparently not. I've tried removing the dependencies and have uploaded the test files on my Nexus page. I /will/ upload them here, but only if they work because Steam doesn't quite allow multiple files under the same Workshop entry. Please do use the Nexus download: all you have to do is unzip the file into your Data folder, even if you're not using their Mod Manager. And if you're still a little phobic of non-Workshop mods, please bear with me in the meantime.
author: Clarota
